text: Are you sure the function in running?
What version of node are you using? (serverless.json)
Are you taking part in the serverless functions dependencies beta? If so you will need to right-click on the .functions folder and then click deploy all

Hi Carter, thanks for the reply!

Yes, the function is running. I am seeing some of the console logs from the existing code. None of the edits are being logged.

I updated the node version to 18.x, it was previously 12.x.

We are not in the beta, that option is not available.
I updated the serverless.json to use a completely different file for the function I am testing, and it functioned the same.
And are you in the serverless dependencies beta? You can check by right clicking on the .functions folder and seeing if there is an option called deploy all functions or something similar
no, we are not in the beta.
Can you share what you currently have inside of your serverless.json file?
the json isn't broken, left out the subsequent lines with keys
and this is the right click menu:
Yeah, all of that looks good, if you literally just deleted everything inside of your function's main () can published it does the function still responded like you haven't updated it?
i changed the function being called to a completely different file, and it was still appearing as the original file was running
e.g. i had this in the file:
and it was still logging as if the original was running
Yeah that definitely means the function isn't deploying
<@U03U053QC72> any ideas why this would be the case?

Thanks for letting me know.
